column4: hi, I can't open pdfs because programs seem to want something in wine to open it, default afaik is set to evince
are you trying to open the pdf from some windows program running under wine or from the file manager?
gnome-open seems to work fine loading evince, but for some reason Referencer will only go through wine, I just fixed a similiar issue with Firefox
maybe the type pdf is associated for some reason in .local/share/applications/mimeapps.list with the wrong application?
and if you click on a pdf in the file manager it gets correctly opened with evince?
yup, seems to be more or less application specific and there are no options in the program (unlike FF) to change the default
can you ask the referencer guys then? i wasn't even aware that this program exists
or try to look up if a configuration file exists. something like ~/.referencer perhaps?

you can go also the hard route and try to figure out which files get opened by referencer with "lsof" or "strace". but you have to filter out a lot of information until you get to the file you need...
if you decide to do this it might be even easier to obtain the source code and look it up there
I was hoping it was just something I had missed since I recently had a similar issue with FireFox, thought the cause may have been the same
maybe. i really don't know. sorry that i cannot help you with this
thanks for trying none the less
